      • getCommandNames

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getCommandNames()
        Gets the names of the command

        A command can have any number of names. They will all be checked for when the command is run

        Returns:
        An array containing the names of the command

      • getPermissions

        public abstract java.lang.String getPermissions()
        Gets the permissions required to run the command
        Returns:
        The required permissions

      • getHelp

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getHelp()
        Gets the help topics of the command

        Each element of the array is one line of the help message
        The very first line should be a short description of the command. Following the first line can be any number of lines containing more information, including a more detailed description, proper usage, etc. If included, the ${command} syntax will be replaced with the command name that was used in executing the command.

        Returns:
        An array containing the help messages of the command

      • canBeDisabled

        public abstract boolean canBeDisabled()
        Gets whether or not the command can be disabled

        For most commands, this should return true. However, if your command provides core functionality, you may wish to have your command not be disabled.

        Returns:
        Whether or not the command can be disabled

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Gets whether or not the command is enabled

        When a command is disabled, any calls to the command will be entirely ignored, and will be passed along to Bukkit's default command handling. The command itself is not unregistered, to prevent name conflicts should another plugin attempt to register a command with a matching name.

        Returns:
        Whether or not the command is enabled

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether or not the command is enabled

        When a command is disabled, any calls to the command will be entirely ignored, and will be passed along to Bukkit's default command handling. The command itself is not unregistered, to prevent name conflicts should another plugin attempt to register a command with a matching name.

        Parameters:
        enabled - The enabled state of the command

      • exec

        public abstract java.lang.String[] exec(CommandWrapper command)
                                 throws TooFewArgumentsException,
                                        TooManyArgumentsException,
                                        InvalidArgumentException,
                                        NoPermissionException,
                                        PlayerOnlyException,
                                        ConsoleOnlyException,
                                        BlockOnlyException
        Runs the command

        This method is called whenever the command is run. All elements of the return value are sent to the user who ran the command. This is the appropriate place to provide any user feedback from the command

        Parameters:
        command - The CommandWrapper associated with a given command
        Returns:
        An array containing user feedback
        Throws:
        TooFewArgumentsException, - TooManyArgumentsException, InvalidArgumentException, NoPermissionException, PlayerOnlyException, ConsoleOnlyException, BlockOnlyException
        TooFewArgumentsException
        TooManyArgumentsException
        InvalidArgumentException
        NoPermissionException
        PlayerOnlyException
        ConsoleOnlyException
        BlockOnlyException
